epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
epd_metadata.notes_on_comparability: EPDs within the same product category but registered in different EPD programmes, or not compliant with EN 15804, may not be comparable. For comparability, EPDs must be based on the same PCR version, cover products with identical functions, have equivalent system boundaries, data quality, allocation methods, cut-off rules, and impact assessment methods.

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Fresh concrete is placed on site or prefabricated, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, with technical parameters such as high strength, durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high pumpability, architectural finishes.

hazardous_substances.dangerous_goods_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to the Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)
databases_and_software.note_on_green_star_indicators: Additional Green Star (v1.3) impact categories modelled separately based on generic processes

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m3 of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.assessment: Good or very good geographic and temporal representativeness
data_quality.background_data_timeliness: All data updated within 10 years as required under PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, electricity generation
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport, concrete manufacturing excluding mixing in truck, waste and wastewater treatment
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, construction waste, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool; includes pouring from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation site work and forms

deconstruction.process: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbon_emission_context.carbonation_note: Lifetime absorption of CO2 by concrete through carbonation is recognized but not included in this EPD
carbon_emission_context.carbon_footprint_reporting: Includes carbon footprint, energy consumption, resource use; transparency enables informed decision-making and benchmarking
carbon_emission_context.sustainability_strategy: Industry's first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregates: Modeled using Ecoinvent database 2023, national scope, good data quality
